content.description:
Year of the Dragon is a bit of an anomaly for Mt. Gretna.  It climbs a slightly overhanging face on, gasp, actual holds!  Plus, the sequence is not cryptic.  

  Start sitting on two crimps.  Backstep and work up solid, small crimps to the obvious, beckoning sloping pinch.  This hold is one of the best in all of Mt. Gretna.  Slap out left around the slight corner to a sidepull.  Keep it together and squeeze the right arete to topout.   

  I always felt that it helped to be tall for this problem.  I could never keep my feet on while moving from the pinch, while I watched Ernie have no problem with it over and over.  I consider this a benchmark problem for V6 at Mt. Gretna.  Of course, that is assuming optimal conditions.  The pinch will feel impossible to hang onto in the summer.  There is an excellent video of this problem on the 2001 film Hard Gret.
content.location: Walk 100 meters past the upper and lower matrix.  Year of the Dragon will be on your right just off the trail, and the problem will face your back.  The boulder is downhill of the large Green Marble boulder.

content.description: The Green Marble (Direct) route starts on the left arete of the Green Marble boulder.  Climb the start of the Green Marble Arete route (the left arete) by stepping up onto a separate small rock underneath.  Gain the left facing flake low, then bust right to the hanging jug rail that lies over the bulge.  Go right for another move to a finger bucket with the right hand and highstep the left foot and mantel to the juggy lip.  A real hair raiser!
content.protection: Pads, spotters, or better yet do not fall.
content.location: Uphill and a bit further down the trail past the Year Of The Dragon (V6).

content.description: Climb the left arete of the Green Marble boulder.  Start by stepping up onto a rock at the base to gain jugs.  Make long moves to grab the left facing flake and then the flat top of the flake.  All of the holds are huge.  Then a big move to the juggy lip.  This problem is in my opinion the best easy highball in all of Mt. Gretna!  It is characterized by long moves to big gym style holds to a tall but easy top out.  The grade is about 5.9+ or easy 5.10.
content.protection: Pads, spotters, or do not fall.
content.location: Walk past the Year Of The Dragon.  The Green Marble is the obvious massive boulder uphill.

content.description:
Start matched on a big flat side pull with feet wide right to a vertical edge. Drop left to the crimps and reposition feet to shoot to the top. Various options--tiny u-shaped micro-crimp, slopers wide left and on top. A little contrived.

 Good practice for diabase top-outs
content.location: Line is left of Year of the Dragon v6
